required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to search the presence of the SARS-COV-2 virus (COVID19) in the pneumoperitoneum of patients with a positive (or suspected) COVID19 status during a routine laparoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: The main objective of the study is to demonstrate the presence of SARS-COV-2 in the exsufflated gas at the end of laparoscopy.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 , at the end of the surgery
primary_outcome.description: The SARS-COV-2 will be looked for in the gas before its elimination at the end of the intervention. To this end, the PCR search will be carried out on the filter used

secondary_outcome.measure: The secondary objective of the study is to demonstrate the presence of SARS-COV-2 in the peritoneal fluid during laparoscopy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 , at the end of the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: SARS-COV-2 will be tested for by PCR in the peritoneal fluid collected during laparoscopy

intervention.intervention_name: Additional and minimal collection of products of the human body carried out during a sample for standard of care
intervention.description: Swab of the peritoneal fluid for traces of COVID19. The collection of peritoneal fluid is a standard care practice. Swab from the laparoscopy filter

biospec_descr.textblock: Excess peritoneal fluid, usually taken during laparoscopy Exsufflation of the pneumoperitoneum through a filter

study_pop.textblock: Any adult requiring a laparoscopic procedure with a positive or suspected Covid19 status.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient of legal age
- Indication for laparoscopy
- Positive (past or current) or suspected Covid19 status (cough, fever, suggestive radiological images, etc.)
- Lack of opposition to participating in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient under legal protection
- Covid19 status negative, (former or current) and not suspected
- Patient unable to object
- Patient with no social security care
